topics.body:
There are three things all wise men fear: the sea in storm, a night with no moon,

and the anger of a Packers fan.

So Toski and I were buying school supplies, and a TV had the Packers vs. Cowboys game. The Packers had just taken the lead, and I was expressing my disagreement.

I was talking smack with my brother, something along the lines of "If the Packers win, I'll..."

Then one of the employees asks us "Do you guys need anything?" I look at her, and on her shirt was a very clear Packers logo. That got us to shut up immediately, and she just giggled at us. It was almost as if she was masking her rage. I feel like her statement came off as "heard u were talkin shit."

So yeah, we were pretty terrified, I responded as best I could and then we nope'd the hell out of there
topics.author: 9ba2e84e636164642cc03200

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b2ee0663687240105b0000#post_54b2ee0663687240105b0000
Oh this is rich. So even if a woman is advocating, for example, white supremacy I have to shut the fuck up because telling her she's wrong is fucking misogyny.

What's more misogynistic? Engaging someone on a topic and trying to work out what's right or wrong, or just shutting up and letting someone wallow in ignorance because they're a delicate little flower who can't cope with criticism because apparently intellectual disagreement is the equivalent of fucking rape?
